actions: Induces sweating, releases the Exterior, disseminates and facilitates Lung Qi, calms wheezing and stops coughing.
With Xing Ren, for Wind-Cold cough and wheezing.
Expels Wind-Dampness, disperses Cold, warms and activates the channels and stops pain.
Disperses Wind-Cold and Internal Cold, warms the Lungs, transforms Phlegm and Thin Mucus and alleviates pain.
With Ma Huang, alleviates cough and wheezing due to Phlegm caused by Wind-Cold.
With Kuan Dong Hua and Zi Wan, for chronic, persistent cough.
Warms the Middle Jiao, disperses Cold and dispels Dampness.
Clears Heat and expels Phlegm.
Dispels Phlegm.
With Ming Fan, for asthma due to profuse Phlegm.
Dries Dampness and transforms Phlegm.
Clears Heat and dissolves Phlegm.
Stops cough and calms wheezing.
With Gan Cao and Ma Huang, for cough with profuse sputum, nasal obstruction and a hoarse voice.
Moistens the Lungs, resolves Phlegm and stops cough.
With Ma Huang and Xing Ren, for coughing or wheezing due to Wind-Cold Attacks the Lungs.
Relieves coughs and expels Phlegm.
Moistens the Lungs, descends Qi, stops cough and transforms Phlegm.
With Zi Wan, for cough with difficult-to-expectorate sputum.
With Xing Ren, for cough and wheezing due to Phlegm Obstruction.

Dries Dampness
Expels Phlegm

symptoms: Cough with copious, thin, white, frothy sputum
Chest and diaphragm congestion with full feeling
Dyspnea which is worse when lying down
Panting with rales in the throat which usually occurs when exposed to Cold
Maybe itchy skin at the beginning of the acute stage
manifestations.tongueCoat: Thick, white and greasy or sticky

notes: Grind the ingredients into a fine powder and make into pills with honey and fresh ginger juice. Take 6g each morning with a decoction of Rx. Glycyrrhizae Gan Cao and Rz. Zingiberis Recens Sheng Jiang.
